chargeHist.descr: Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear
Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner S. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).
  • Illegal Hunting Deer/Carcass, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.971(11).
  • Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: EACH COUNT CONCURRENT AND CONCURRENT TO PIERCE COUNTY CASE 14CF187

records.addlTxt: 11:21 Defendant Tanner S. Brown in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM38 heard at this time. Froelich: guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 14CF187. DJOC on Ct#1. Restitution TBD wi 30 days.  1 probation on Ct#2. conditions: 1 week jail court costs. Guilty to Ct#1,3,5 in 15CM38. Dismiss Ct#2 and Ct#4. Fine on Ct#1; $1000 base with costs. probation on Ct#3 and Ct#5; concurrent with Ct#2 in 14CF187. 3 year restriction and revocation of any approvals on Ct#1,3,5 in 15CM38. Request another hearing on surrender of guns. Nelson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty in the information to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 14CF187; Nelson stipulates to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2. Court withholds the entering of the JOC to Ct#1. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1, Ct#3, and Ct#5 in 15CM38; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1,3,5 in 15CM38   and  Ct 2 & 4 are dismissed.  15CM38: Court orders on  Ct 1  $1000.00 fine plus costs around 1513.00 for total  .  Court: S/W 1 year probation on Ct#2 in 14CF187. conditions: 1 week jail with huber stayed until May 8, 2015 at 7pm. cost courts.   S/W Probation 1 years conc on Ct#1, #2, Ct#3 of 15CM38 and concurrent to sentence in 14CF187. conditions: Restitution TBD 30 days. court costs on each count.  DA will file amended case on 15CM38     All hunting lic are revoked for 3 yrs.    14CF187:  Court accepts the deferred agreement on 14CF187.

10:18  Defendant Tanner S. Brown in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives further reading of the complaint   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to all counts  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
